intro: Pleiarina pentandra, commonly known as the five-angled pleiarina, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its pentagonal-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical studies and conservation efforts.
